keyMoments.title: Luffy's Final Blow Strikes the Golden Bell
keyMoments.description: Luffy delivers his decisive final attack to Enel, causing the golden ball attached to his arm to strike the massive Golden Bell, creating a ring that echoes across all of Sky Island and down to the Blue Sea.
keyMoments.significance: This moment marks the culmination of the Skypiea arc and fulfills the 400-year-old promise to ring the bell. It symbolizes the end of Enel's tyrannical rule.

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Shadow Appears on the Clouds
keyMoments.description: As the Golden Bell rings, a massive shadow of Luffy in a triumphant pose is projected onto the clouds above Jaya, visible to Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance.
keyMoments.significance: This visual confirms to Cricket that the Straw Hats succeeded and are safe, creating an iconic moment of victory.

keyMoments.title: Discussing Next Moves with the Crew
keyMoments.description: Luffy and the crew discuss what to do next. Luffy and Usopp veto Nami's suggestion to return to the Going Merry immediately, hinting at unfinished business.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's leadership and sets up continued exploration of Sky Island.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Luffy's Final Attack
keyMoments.description: Enel is struck by Luffy's final blow that causes the Golden Bell to ring, marking the end of his reign as 'God' of Sky Island.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the fall of the tyrant and the liberation of Sky Island from his rule.

keyMoments.title: Departs for the Moon on Ark Maxim
keyMoments.description: Having survived Luffy's assault, Enel regains consciousness, restarts the Ark Maxim with his lightning powers, and departs Sky Island heading toward what he calls 'Fairy Vearth' (the moon).
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Enel's future story arc and introduces the mystery of the moon in One Piece lore, maintaining his godlike delusions despite defeat.

reveals.information: Enel's 'Fairy Vearth' is revealed to be the moon

name.japanese: モンブラン・クリケット

keyMoments.title: Hears the Golden Bell from Jaya
keyMoments.description: Mont Blanc Cricket hears the sound of the Golden Bell ringing from the sky and breaks down in tears, realizing that the City of Gold truly existed and was always in the sky, vindicating his ancestor Noland's story.
keyMoments.significance: Provides emotional closure to Cricket's storyline and proves that Noland was not a liar, validating Cricket's lifelong search and his family's honor.

keyMoments.title: Sees Luffy's Shadow on the Clouds
keyMoments.description: Cricket witnesses Luffy's triumphant shadow projected on the clouds and realizes the Straw Hats are safe and victorious.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms that the crew he helped reach Sky Island succeeded in their adventure and are celebrating their victory.

reveals.information: Cricket's lifelong belief that the City of Gold exists is proven true

keyMoments.title: Witnesses the End of the 400-Year War
keyMoments.description: Wyper witnesses the Skypieans and Shandians celebrating together in peace, marking the end of the 400-year conflict.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the fulfillment of the Shandians' ancestral dreams and the resolution of the war Wyper has fought his entire life.

keyMoments.title: Wyper Smiles at the Celebration
keyMoments.description: Wyper, the fierce Shandian warrior who has dedicated his life to fighting, is shown smiling as he watches the celebration between Skypieans and Shandians.
keyMoments.significance: Marks significant character growth for Wyper, showing his acceptance of peace and the genuine resolution of the conflict.

reveals.information: Wyper accepts peace between Skypieans and Shandians

keyMoments.title: Revealed to Be Alive and Reunites with Conis
keyMoments.description: Pagaya, who was believed to have been killed by Enel's lightning attack, is revealed to have survived by being blown into the White Sea. He reunites with his daughter Conis.
keyMoments.significance: Provides joyful relief and demonstrates that not all of Enel's victims perished, adding to the celebratory atmosphere.

reveals.information: Pagaya survived Enel's lightning attack by being blown into the White Sea

keyMoments.title: Reunites with Father Pagaya
keyMoments.description: Conis is joyfully reunited with her father Pagaya, who she believed had been killed by Enel.
keyMoments.significance: Represents hope and relief, showing the restoration of families after Enel's defeat.

keyMoments.title: Experiences Earth for the First Time
keyMoments.description: Conis and other Skypieans explore Upper Yard and touch real earth (Vearth) for the first time in their lives.
keyMoments.significance: Emphasizes the importance and wonder of Vearth to Sky Island's people and the newfound access they have with peace.

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Peace Between Skypieans and Shandians
keyMoments.description: Gan Fall, the former god of Sky Island, witnesses the historic moment when Skypieans and Shandians celebrate together in peace.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the fulfillment of what Gan Fall tried to achieve during his reign and validates his efforts toward peace.

keyMoments.title: Hears the Golden Bell with Cricket
keyMoments.description: Masira, alongside Cricket and Shoujou, hears the sound of the Golden Bell ringing from the sky, proving the City of Gold exists.
keyMoments.significance: Validates the Saruyama Alliance's support of Cricket's dream and the Straw Hats' journey.

keyMoments.title: Hears the Golden Bell with Cricket
keyMoments.description: Shoujou, alongside Cricket and Masira, hears the sound of the Golden Bell ringing from the sky, proving the City of Gold exists.
keyMoments.significance: Validates the Saruyama Alliance's support of Cricket's dream and the Straw Hats' journey.

keyMoments.title: Reminds Crew They're Still Broke
keyMoments.description: Zoro points out to the crew that despite all their efforts in Skypiea, they're still broke and haven't found treasure.
keyMoments.significance: Provides comedic relief and sets up the crew's continued exploration.

keyMoments.title: Suggests Returning to Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Nami suggests the crew should return to the Going Merry, but Luffy and Usopp veto the idea.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the crew's different priorities and foreshadows continued exploration.

keyMoments.title: Prefers Collecting Dials Over Treasure
keyMoments.description: Usopp mentions he prefers collecting Dials over traditional treasure and joins Luffy in vetoing Nami's suggestion to return to the ship.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's interest in Sky Island technology and his enthusiasm for unique items.
